Articles.Content:
In my opinion, getting Kerbals to the Mun and back wasn't a real challenge. Instead, I started to build a compact, light rover with simple balanced parts. I used mods since the vanilla parts were simply too big for my purposes. and vanilla didn't have unmanned pods. It took quite some time to build and I axperienced with a lot of designs and started from scratch a few times.

With a mass of under 4 tons this rover SHOULD be easy to get to the Mun, however Having a proper lander for it proved to be difficult. And with the separate lander, the weight quickly went over 15 tons. I also messed up the Kerbin orbit, because I forgot to install one fuel line on the rocket. However, I had plenty of excess fuel and was able to correct my mistakes and make good landing, roughly 20km away from my target... downhill. My lander actually has enough fuel to go from 110km Kerbin orbit to the Mun and land safely.

NOTE! Most of the mods require plugins to install, they are mentioned on the mod pages.

Mods used:

MMI SatPack

MechJeb

Soyuz solar panels

Katepillar Wheels

BikTrak

ISA MapSat

Fixed Camera

Muon Detector

NovaPunch

I wanted the rover and lander to be separate to eliminate all excess mass of the rover, while still maintaining some realism. For one, the rover would need a motor and I decided that I'd stick a couple of solar panels and a battery on it. Soyuz solar panels were light and compact enough for my rover and the MMI battery didn't weigh much more. Thus, I had the ability to run the "motors" on the Katepillar Wheels that provided the mobility I needed. The MMI command module was a lightweight unmanned pod and the fact it had MechJeb meeant I didn't need an ASAS module. With the battery, my rover would be able to operate during the night... except for the fact that I wouldn't be able to see anything. For that, I installed floodlights from the BikTrak pack. ISA MapSat was important for navigation and the Muon detector was there in case the previous didn't work. For acquiring data, I installed a camera to the front. The base of the rover is a 1.25m fairing plate from the NovaPunch modpack.

Nice design!

Personally, I went with a "stock" folding Mun Rover from Tosh (which comes with lights), a MechJeb pod for control, and a Fixed Camera; I handwaved the power issues, figuring the onboard batteries would get me anywhere I had the patience to go.
Yeah. I don't want to do it the easy way. Nuh-uh xD
